intro: Maccraithea, commonly known as the African snowbush, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. Maccraithea is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in challenging conditions.
